sn2.13:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
sn2.13:1.3: Then, late at night, the glorious god Dīghalaṭṭhi, lighting up the entire Bamboo Grove, went up to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side,
sn2.13:1.4: and recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
sn2.13:2.1: “Suppose a mendicant is a meditator, freed in mind.
sn2.13:2.2: If they want to reach the heart’s peace,
sn2.13:2.3: having known the arising and passing of the world,
sn2.13:2.4: healthy-minded, independent, that is their reward.”
